# San Francisco School of Digital Filmmaking

| logo              =
| footnotes         =
}}
San Francisco Film School, also formerly known as the San Francisco School of Digital Filmmaking and FilmSchoolSF, is a private, for-profit  vocational film school in San Francisco, California. The school was founded by Stephen Kopels and Jeremiah Birnbaum in 2005 and works in conjunction with Fog City Productions, a local independent production company, to teach students the art and craft of filmmaking. The programs include an [https://www.sanfranciscofilmschool.edu/programs/associate-of-applied-science-in-digital-filmmaking/ Associate of Applied Sciences in Digital Filmmaking], a [https://www.sanfranciscofilmschool.edu/programs/professional-certificate-in-digital-filmmaking/ Professional Certificate] program, [https://www.sanfranciscofilmschool.edu/programs/ workshops], and a [https://www.sanfranciscofilmschool.edu/2024-spring-gap-year-semester/ GAP Year Semester Program].
Feature films created in school
* Presque Isle
* Around June
* Moonlight Sonata
* Trattoria
* Two Mothers
